text: This is a download from BBC Learning English.
To find out more, visit our website.
6MuteEnglish
from BBCLearningEnglish.com
Hello and welcome to 6MuteEnglish. I'm Alice.
And I'm Rob… Now, Alice – how old are you?
speaker: Rob

text: I'm 21, Rob – not a day older!
speaker: Alice

text: Come on, don't be coy about your age, Alice.
Cooy, by the way, means not wanting to give away information about yourself.
I'm not being coy, Rob. I just… don't feel like telling everyone how old I am. Some people think it's rude to ask.
speaker: Alice

text: Some people think it's rude to ask.
I don't mean to be rude, of course, but, well, you are being coy.
I don't mean to be rude of course but … well, you are being coy. I'm asking because today we're talking about age and whether you can be too old for some things. What do you think?
speaker: Rob

text: What do you think?
I'm too old to order of children's menus in restaurants, but I still do it.
Anything else?
speaker: Rob

text: Well, I couldn't pull an all-nighter anymore.
speaker: pull an all-nighter

text: Okay, that's another way of saying,
stay up all night to finish something.
That's what students do to get their work done.
I used to be able to do it, and now I couldn't.
I struggled to stay up on New Year's Eve until midnight.
But let's move on to today's quiz question.
What percentage of people aged over 65 surveyed in the UK
described themselves as old?
Is it a 6% B 16% or C 60%?
Well, I think it's just a 6%.
Well, I think it's just a) 6%. People don't like to think of themselves as old.
speaker: Rob

text: Well, we'll find out if you got the answer right or wrong later in the show.
First, let's explore the subject of aging more.
Tell me, Rob, do you think you can be too old to take up a new hobby?
Oh, I might be. I mean, it depends on the hobby, of course.
I might be, I mean, depends on the hobby of course. I went for a run the other day, and it nearly killed me.
speaker: Rob

text: Oh, that just means you're unfit, Rob.
Ah.
Let's listen to Ernestine Shepherd, who didn't think she was too old
to take up an interesting new hobby.
At the age of 71, she started bodybuilding,
and is currently listed in the Guinness Book of Records
as the oldest female bodybuilder in the world.
If ever there were an anti-aging pill, I would call it exercise.
I enjoy working out with the people who come to the church.
Sometimes they say, oh, this hurts.
But I tell people, age is nothing but a number.
I am 75 years of age.
This morning, I awakened at 2.30.
I have a group of four other people who run with me in the mornings.
We run about 10 miles every day.
Wow! That was Ernestine Shepherd. What an example to us all!
speaker: Rob

text: What an example to a soul.
Work out, by the way, means taking exercise to make yourself fit.
I think it's true that if we did more exercise every day,
we would all look and feel much better.
Ernestine is all for exercise, but I'm afraid I take some anti-aging pill,
if one existed.
If something is advertised as being anti-aging,
If something is advertised as being anti-aging it means it's designed to stop you looking older.
speaker: anti-aging

text: And you can find hundreds of products these days
that claim to have anti-aging properties.
Lots of lotions and potions for women in particular.
Yes, that's because women feel pressurised to look younger than their age.
It's an example of ageism and it isn't fair.
Ageism means discrimination against people because of their age.
And sometimes people can be discriminated against in the workplace for being too old.
Now, do you think you could be too old to take up a new job, Alice?
No, I don't get the concept of too old at all.
My grandparents both still work,
and they have more enthusiasm and energy than I do.
They hate being called senior citizens and old age pensioners
or by the initials of these words, O-A-P.
And they're right.
Who wants to be defined by their age?
You just said don't get this concept
and to get something means to understand it.
So I suppose you stay the same inside.
It's just the outside that changes.
We have to be young at heart at least.
And age is no reason for some people to stop working
if they're in good health.
Let's listen to Trisha Custon,
who started a new business at 65,
supplying beauty products for older women.
Her age actually inspired her choice of work.
I had an idea.
I've seen a problem and an opportunity.
And I've done something about it and created a business
which I'm very happy to say is very successful.
I mean, I started it.
It was going to be a hobby.
You know, something to keep me out of trouble.
Give me something to do.
Trisha Custon there.
She started a new hobby and it turned
into a successful business enterprise.
Now, before we finish,
I'd just like to put the case for older men.
My dad, my granddad, Sean Connery, Michael Cain,
Harrison Ford, they're all fantastic role models
for us younger guys.
Mmm, and a role model is somebody people admire and want copy.
Well, that brings us round to the matter of today's quiz question, Alice.
speaker: Rob

text: of today's quiz question, Alice.
Yes, it does.
I asked, what percentage of people aged over 65 surveyed
in the UK described themselves as old in a survey?
Is it a 6% b 16% or c 60%?
Yep. And I said a) 6%. Was I right?
speaker: Rob

text: Yes, you were.
You were right.
Well done.
More than 2,000 people aged between 65 and 93
were surveyed by UK market research firm UGov.
Now, here are the words we learnt today, Rob.
They were,
coy, pull and all-nighter,
anti-aging
speaker: Rob

text: ageism
speaker: Rob

text: senior citizen
speaker: Rob

text: old age pensioner,
or OAP.
get something
speaker: Rob

text: Well, that's the end of today's 6 Minute English. Don't forget to join us again soon!
speaker: Alice

text: Don't forget to join us again soon.
Bye-bye. Bye-bye.
6 Minute English from the BBC.
